title: PSYC 336 The Psychology of Language I
description: Psychological abilities underlying human language; language processing, lexical representation, and principles of online conversation; animal versus human communication.
prerequisites: Either (a) PSYC 100 or (b) all of PSYC 101, PSYC 102. (Non-PSYC students may substitute ENGL 329, or LING 420, or LING 200 and 201 for the above prerequisite.)
